original: taṃ pranasyata sātatvaṃ vakṣye vinayakārikām iti //
analyzed: tam pranasyata sāta tvam vakṣye vinaya kārikām iti

original: tad ekadeśa bhūtaṃ caidam ity anena nātrābhihitaṃ /
analyzed: tat bhūtam ca edam iti anena na atra abhihitam
translated: And this is a part of that, so it is said by this.

original: ata eva prakīrṇavinaya ity ādinā tayavatām asya sūcayati śāstrakāra ity ato na doṣaḥ /
analyzed: atas eva prakīrṇa vinayaḥ iti ādinā tayavatām asya sūcayati śāstra kāraḥ iti atas na doṣaḥ
translated: For this very reason, the author of the treatise indicates this by the phrase in the Miscellaneous Vinaya and so on. Therefore, there is no fault.

original: Slkv prakīrṇake hi yad viṃśatisahasrāyuṣiprajāyāṃ bhagavataḥ kāśyapasya kṛkina
analyzed: prakīrṇake prakīrṇaka SLM hi yat viṃśati sahasra āyuṣi prajāyām bhagavataḥ kāśyapasya kṛkina
translated: For in the Miscellaneous Section, when the lifespan of beings was twenty thousand years, the Blessed One was named Kāśyapa.

original: rājñā stūpaḥ kṛtaḥ yojanam uccatvena yojanaṃ pariṇāhena ardhayojana pratisareṇa krośamātrikayā vedikayā /
analyzed: rājñā stūpaḥ kṛtaḥ yojanam ucca tvena yojanam pariṇāhena ardha yojana pratisareṇa krośa mātrikayā vedikayā
translated: A stūpa was built by King Kṛkī, one yojana in height and one yojana in circumference, with a surrounding wall half a yojana wide and a platform one krosa wide.

analyzed: tāmra loha raitikāya hasta cāraṇāya tam upadarśayitvā uktam
translated: Having shown that, it is said:🔽A stūpa should be built on a flat piece of land. It should be made like this.

analyzed: vedī jaṃghā puṣpa grahaṇīyam

original: ā yakā aṇḍakaṃ kaṇṭhakaṃ kaṇṭhikā harmikā cchatrāvalī cchatraṃ ghaṇṭā dhvajaḥ patākā stūpagṛha āgama puṣkiriṇī prākāra coktaṃ /

analyzed: punar prakīrṇa saṃbandhe na idam uktam

translated: By me, who became a universal monarch, a stūpa was built one yojana in height and one yojana in circumference.

analyzed: tat anyeṣām nikāyānām iti sarvāstivādinām stūpakalpanāsūtre kṣudrake ca uktam

original: Slkv sagṛhastūpaḥ stambhaś catasraḥ pariṣaṇṇāḥ stambha sopāna lokapālā sthā sacandrasitāmbaraḥ patākā makaradhvajādayaḥ coktāḥ /

analyzed: kūṭāgāra kūṭāgāra Cp sūtre sūtra SLNe ca ca  uktam vac SNPaNe

analyzed: tasmin stūpe sūcī mātram yaṣṭim āropayet

analyzed: badarī patra mātram chatram āropayet

analyzed: apratiṣṭhite anya caitya rahite

analyzed: madhya bhāga parikṣepaḥ paribandha yathā āroha pariṇāha saṃpanna puruṣaḥ iti
translated: The measurement of the middle part is paribandha, like a person endowed with height and breadth.

analyzed: tatra ca āroha śabdena ucca tvam kathyate  na pariṇāha śabdena ucca tvam
translated: And there, the word āroha denotes height.🔽Not the word parināha denotes height.

analyzed: pariṇāha śabdena abhidhānāt
translated: Because it is denoted by the word parināha.

original: Slkv evam ihāpi pariṇāhaśabdena maṇḍalanābheś caturdiśaṃ /
analyzed: evam evam  iha iha  api api  pariṇāha pariṇāha Cp śabdena śabda SIM maṇḍala maṇḍala Cp nābheḥ nābhi SGF caturdiśam caturdiśam
translated: In the same way, here also, by the word parināha, the measurement of the circumference of the mandala in the four directions,

analyzed: cakra āra nyāyena madhya sūtra parikṣepaḥ paribandhaḥ
translated: the paribandha, the measurement of the middle thread, is meant by the principle of the spokes of a wheel.

original: caturthī pi kalaśādisthasaṃsthāneṣu tan mātraṃ pṛthutvasyāvyabhicārāt /
analyzed: kalaśa ādi stha saṃsthāneṣu tat mātram pṛthu tvasya avyabhicārāt
translated: And in the fourth case, in the shapes of the water pot and so on, that much breadth is invariable.

original: kiṃ saṃbandhinā pariṇāhena kumbhasya kumbhuḥ karaṇḍaka tasya pariṇāhena stūpa dairgheṇeṣṭam ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: kim saṃbandhinā pariṇāhena kumbhasya kumbhuḥ karaṇḍaka tasya pariṇāhena stūpa dairgheṇa iṣṭam iti arthaḥ
translated: With what kind of parināha is the pot? The pot is a basket, with its parināha, the stūpa is meant to be long.

original: uktaṃ hi prakīrṇavinaye yojanam uccatvena yojanaṃ pariṇāheneti /🔽caturasrā bhaven nemir ity ādi /
analyzed: uktam hi prakīrṇa vinaye yojanam ucca tvena yojanam pariṇāhena iti  catur asrā bhavet nemiḥ iti ādi
translated: For it is said in the Miscellaneous Vinaya: One yojana in height, one yojana in breadth.🔽The rim should be square, and so on.

original: caturasrā catuṣkoṇabhūmyāṃ kumbhaḥ karaṇḍaḥ maṇḍalānurūpyena nemivistāro bhavatīty arthaḥ /
analyzed: catur asrā catuṣkoṇa bhūmyām kumbhaḥ karaṇḍaḥ maṇḍala ānurūpyena nemi vistāraḥ bhavati iti arthaḥ
translated: The square, with four corners, the pot, the basket, the breadth of the rim is according to the mandala, this is the meaning.

analyzed: atra prakīrṇe ca  uktam vac SNPaNe
translated: And this is said in the Miscellaneous (chapter):

original: eṣa kaścit stūpaṃ kārayatā prācīrāntāt tāvat kārayitavyeti tad anukramārthaṃ cātra caturasrake maṇḍalasūtrapātād bāhyābāhyato madhyakoṣṭhaparikṣepo
analyzed: eṣa kaścid stūpam kārayatā prācīra antāt tāvat kārayitavyā iti tat anukrama artham ca atra caturasrake maṇḍala sūtra pātāt bāhya abāhyatas madhya koṣṭha parikṣepaḥ
translated: When someone is having a stupa built, it should be built up to the edge of the wall. For the sake of that sequence, here in the square mandala, the outer and inner perimeter of the central square should be determined by the fall of the string.

analyzed: bhyantarataḥ ca
translated: And inside.

analyzed: eka asīti koṣṭhaka nyāye sa vijñeyām
translated: That should be known according to the principle of eighty-one squares.

original: Slkv p / tato 'bhyantare ca nemibhittivistārārdhena draṣṭavyam iti /
analyzed: tatas tatas  bhyantare bhyantara SLNe ca ca  nemi nemi Cp bhitti bhitti Cp vistāra vistāra Cp ardhena ardha SINe draṣṭavyam dṛś SNNeGd iti iti
translated: Then, it should be seen that half the width of the outer rim and wall is inside.

analyzed: karaṇḍakasya aṣṭa bhāgena iti kumbha pariṇāha aṣṭa māṃsena adhastāt nemyāḥ nimarjanam
translated: By one-eighth of the water pot, etc. means that the outer rim is dug down below by one-eighth of the circumference of the pot.

original: udakodbhedaṃ vā yāvad āśuddher vā bhuvaḥ pṛthivyāḥ smṛtam ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: udaka udbhedam vā yāvat āśuddheḥ vā bhuvaḥ pṛthivyāḥ smṛtam iti arthaḥ
translated: Or it is said that the water should be brought up to the level of the ground, or until the earth is pure. This is the meaning.

original: aṣṭabhāgonnatam ity ādi nemimānād aṣṭamāṃsam ādāya tenājitam unnataṃ kāryam ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: aṣṭa bhāga unnatam iti ādi nemi mānāt aṣṭa māṃsam ādāya tena ajitam unnatam kāryam iti arthaḥ
translated: Raised by one-eighth, etc. means that taking one-eighth of the measure of the outer rim, it should be raised by that. This is the meaning.

original: Slkv yataḥ prakīrṇake h' / uktaṃ /🔽aṃgana na khasthala kāryam iti /
analyzed: yatas yatas  prakīrṇake prakīrṇaka SLNe h h  uktam vac SNPaNe aṃgana na khasthala kāryam iti
translated: Because it is said in the Miscellaneous (chapter):🔽The courtyard should be made level.

original: vistāratas tv ayā vedikād bahiḥ kumbhapariṇāhapādenaiṣṭaṃ /
analyzed: vistārataḥ tu ayā vedikāt bahis kumbha pariṇāha pādena eṣṭam
translated: But outside the altar, it should be made one-eighth of the circumference of the pot in width.

original: catur asrikā medhī vedī jaṃghāpuṭāvedī kartavyeti /
analyzed: catur asrikā medhī vedī jaṃghā puṭā vedī kartavyā iti
translated: The altar should be square, the intermediate altar should be rectangular, and the foot-altar should be made rectangular.

analyzed: sarva sarva astivādakānām āgameṣu uktam
translated: It is said in the scriptures of all the Sarvāstivādins:

original: catasra pariṣaṇṇāḥ kartavyā iti catus tri dv' /
analyzed: catasra pariṣaṇṇāḥ kartavyāḥ iti catuḥ tri dvi
translated: Four altars should be made. Four, three, two,

analyzed: saṃkhyāya iti anenena vedikā abhisaṃbandhaḥ kriyate
translated: and one should be counted. By this, the connection with the altars is made.

analyzed: catasraḥ parisaṇṇā kartavyāḥ
translated: Four altars should be made.

analyzed: catvāri smṛti upasthānāni prathamā vedī
translated: The four establishments of mindfulness are the first altar.

analyzed: yāvat paṃca indriyāṇi caturthī vedī
translated: Up to the five faculties are the fourth altar.

analyzed: anena iva vinaye uktāḥ vedikānām
translated: In this way, the altars are mentioned in the Vinaya.

analyzed: katamaḥ saṃsthāna abhisaṃbandhaḥ kriyate
translated: What is the connection made with the shape?

original: tad āha ca catuṣkonāṣṭakoṇā vā athavā parimaṇḍaleti /
analyzed: tat āha ca catuṣkona aṣṭa koṇā vā athavā parimaṇḍalā iti
translated: It is said: Either square, octagonal, or circular.

analyzed: sarvāḥ gṛh eka saṃyuktān iti ādinā
translated: All are taken with one connection, and so on.

analyzed: āyaka puṣpa grahāṇi āpekṣatām
translated: The four corners should be made like the shape of a flower.

analyzed: caturthī jaṃghā vedikāt kuryāt iti
translated: The fourth should be made from the foot-altar. This is the meaning.

analyzed: yatas prakīrṇake uktam
translated: Because it is said in the Miscellaneous (Section):

analyzed: catur dikṣu āyakāḥ kartavyāḥ
translated: Four corners should be made.

analyzed: ayam eṣu buddha vigrahāḥ sthāpayitavyāḥ
translated: In these, images of the Buddha should be placed.

analyzed: puṣpa grahaṇī kartavyā iti
translated: A flower-holder should be made.

analyzed: tatra āyaka śabdena pratipālakam ucyate
translated: There, the word corner refers to a protector.

original: puṣpagrahaṇīśabdena na ca vedikābāhyata samantato vāpya paṃktyākāreṇa nānāsaṃsthānagṛhadvāramātre pūrvajātakapratimāṇāṃ racaneti //
analyzed: puṣpa grahaṇī śabdena na ca samantataḥ vāpya paṃkti ākāreṇa nānā saṃsthāna gṛha dvāra mātre pūrva jātaka pratimāṇām racanā iti
translated: And by the word flower-holder, not outside the platform, but all around in the form of a row, one should make images of the previous births in the form of various houses, like doors.

analyzed: adhas adhas  catuskoṇake catuskoṇaka bhāga iti ādi
translated: And below, in the four corners, etc.

original: harmikām upādāya yo 'dhaś caturthako Slkv p / bāhyakoṣṭhāṃśas tatra dhānyarāśikṛtaḥ /
analyzed: harmikām upādāya yaḥ dhaḥ caturthakaḥ bāhya koṣṭha aṃśaḥ tatra dhānya rāśi kṛtaḥ
translated: Starting from the harmika, in the outer square part below, there is a heap of grain.

analyzed: sarveṇa eva caturthakena  tribhiḥ pādaiḥ pātra ākṛti
translated: And with the entire fourth [part].🔽With three feet, in the shape of a vessel.

analyzed: dvābhyām pādābhyām khagaṇḍa ākṛteḥ
translated: With two feet, in the shape of a bird's head.

analyzed: pāda ekena kalaśa ākārasya iti
translated: With one foot, in the shape of a water pot.

analyzed: madhya koṣṭha pramāṇam iti madhya koṣṭha pramāṇa adya pramāṇa gatena iti ādi
translated: The size of the central square, etc. means starting from the size of the central square.

analyzed: etat uktam bhavati
translated: This is what is said:

analyzed: tatra api bhāga vibhāgena dhānya rāśi ākṛteḥ
translated: There also, by dividing the parts, in the shape of a heap of grain.

original: madhyakoṣṭhapramāṇena tisro vedyaḥ kāryāḥ pariśiṣṭānāṃ tu yathā pratyanusāreneti /
analyzed: madhya koṣṭha pramāṇena tisraḥ vedyaḥ kāryāḥ pariśiṣṭānām tu yathā pratyanusārena iti
translated: Three altars should be made with the size of the central square, but the remaining ones according to their respective measurements.

analyzed: caturthī biṃba paśya gā iti kumbha parigraha anurodhena iti arthaḥ
translated: The fourth is at the end of the image, meaning according to the size of the water pot.

analyzed: etat uktam bhavati
translated: This is what is said:

original: adhaś caturthake bhāge kṛtānāṃ tisrāṇāṃ vedīnāṃ yāvantām apramāṇaṃ /
analyzed: adhas caturthake bhāge kṛtānām tisrāṇām vedīnām yāvantām apramāṇam
translated: The extent of the three altars made in the fourth part below.

original: caturthī jaṃghāvedī catuṣkoṣṭhāpi kumbhasaṃsthāneṣv ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: caturthī jaṃghāvedī catuṣkoṣṭhā api kumbha saṃsthāneṣu iti arthaḥ
translated: The fourth is the calf altar, also four squares, meaning in the shape of a pot.

analyzed: yathaḥ prakīrṇake uktam
translated: As it is said in the Miscellaneous (Section):

analyzed: jaṃghā puṭa vedī kukṣitavyā iti  jaṃghāyāḥ puṭa vedī jaṃghā puṭa vedī iti
translated: The calf-pit altar should be made.🔽The calf-pit altar is the altar in the pit of the calf.

original: jaṃghāsaṃbandhinī vā puṭāvedī kumbhasya padmavalitam ity arthaḥ /🔽Slkv bāhyakoṣṭhaṣaḍāyāmety ādi /🔽ṣaṇṇāṃ bāhyakoṣṭhānāṃ yo vistāras tad āyāmānāṃ tad dairghyām adhovedī kuryāt /
analyzed: jaṃghā saṃbandhinī vā puṭa āvedī kumbhasya padma valitam iti arthaḥ  bāhya bāhya Cp koṣṭha koṣṭha Cp ṣaṣ ṣaṣ Cp āyāma āyāma Cp iti iti  ādi  ṣaṇṇām bāhyakoṣṭhānām yaḥ vistāraḥ tat āyāmānām tat dairghyām adhovedī kuryāt
translated: Or the altar in the pit belonging to the calf, meaning the lotus-shaped part of the pot.🔽The outer squares are six in breadth, etc.🔽The breadth of the six outer squares is their length. With that, one should make the lower altar.

original: atha bāhyakoṣṭhena vedikā ukteti ṣaṭsaṃkhyaparicchinnaāyāmo yasyā vedyaḥ sābāhyakoṣṭha ṣaḍāyāmamātrām adhovedīṃ kalpayet /
analyzed: atha bāhya koṣṭhena vedikā uktā iti ṣaṣ saṃkhya paricchinna āyāmaḥ yasyāḥ vedyaḥ sā abāhyakoṣṭha ṣaṣ āyāma mātrām adhas vedīm kalpayet
translated: Or if the altar is said to be with the outer square, the altar whose length is limited by the number six should be made six squares in breadth.

original: yataḥ prakīrṇake yojanam uccasya krośamātrāvedīm ukteti /
analyzed: yatas prakīrṇake yojanam uccasya krośa mātrā vedīm uktā iti
translated: Because in the Miscellaneous (Section) it is said that for a high one yojana, the altar should be one krosa.

analyzed: tat anya anukrama kṣīṇām iti
translated: The other three are reduced in order.

analyzed: adhas vedi āyāmāt upari vartinyaḥ tisraḥ vedyaḥ
translated: The three altars above the length of the lower altar.

analyzed: tāni anukrameṇa madhya koṣṭha pramāṇena kuryāt
translated: Those should be made in order with the measure of the middle square.

original: athavā catasraḥ pariṣaṇṇāḥ kartavyā iti vacanāt //
analyzed: athavā catasraḥ pariṣaṇṇāḥ kartavyāḥ iti vacanāt
translated: Or, because it is said that four assemblies should be made.

analyzed: meru pariṣaṇḍa vat
translated: Like the terraces of Mount Meru.

original: ardhardhonnati Slkv p / kṣīṇañ ca kalpayet /
analyzed: ardhardha unnati sam  kṣīṇam kṣi SAPaNe ca ca  kalpayet
translated: The height should be reduced by half and half again.

original: evaṃ tāvad bhūṅ gata stūpam ākhyāyādhunā bhūmimarjane stūpaṃ kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: evam tāvat bhūm gata stūpam ākhyāya adhunā bhūmi marjane stūpam kṛtam
translated: Thus far, having described the stupa on the ground, now, having made the stupa on the ground,

analyzed: bhuvaḥ tu kalpanācalāt eva iti arthaḥ
translated: the ground is to be leveled. The meaning is: from the very immovable ground.

analyzed: sthairya puṣṭi karam kila bhavati iti
translated: It is said to bring stability and nourishment.

original: ato bhūmyā nimarjanena kāraṇāyāyan darśayann āha /
analyzed: atas bhūmyāḥ nimarjanena kāraṇāya āyan darśayan āha
translated: Therefore, showing the reason for leveling the ground, he says:

analyzed: vetsyā diśu samam
translated: It should be known as even.

original: idan tu nimarjane nimarjanārthaṃ bhūmau stūpasya bhavatu unmānato kṣayo vedikānāṃ vistāras tu kim arthaṃ /
analyzed: idam tu nimarjane nimarjana artham bhūmau stūpasya bhavatu kṣayaḥ vedikānām vistāraḥ tu kim artham
translated: But for the sake of leveling, let there be a stupa on the ground. The height should be reduced. What is the purpose of the width of the platforms?

analyzed: stūpasya ucca tvena samīkaraṇa artham
translated: For the sake of equalizing with the height of the stupa.

original: yata stūpāyāmatulyo hy adho vedyā vistāra iṣyate /
analyzed: yatas stūpa āyāma tulyaḥ hi adhas vedyāḥ vistāraḥ iṣyate
translated: Because the width below the platform is considered unequal to the length of the stupa.

original: Slkv yathā hy uktaṃ mahāvastuni cakravartibhūtena mayā stūpo kṛto yojanoccatvena yojanam abhiniveśeneti /
analyzed: yathā hi uktam mahā vastuni cakravarti bhūtena mayā stūpaḥ kṛtaḥ yojana ucca tvena yojanam abhiniveśena iti
translated: For it is said in the Mahavastu: When I became a universal monarch, I made a stupa one yojana in height and one yojana in extent.

original: yatra hi yathā dhānyarāśyākṛteḥ kumbhasya yojanāni niveśya yojanābhiniveśo gamyate /
analyzed: yatra hi yathā dhānya rāśi ākṛteḥ kumbhasya yojanāni niveśya yojana abhiniveśaḥ gamyate
translated: For where the extent of a yojana is understood by placing yojanas in the shape of a heap of grain,

original: tathā vedikāyā api tu kumbhapariṇāha pramāṇena stūpa uccābhipretaḥ /
analyzed: tathā vedikāyāḥ api tu kumbha pariṇāha pramāṇena stūpaḥ ucca abhipretaḥ
translated: Similarly, the stupa is intended to be as high as the circumference of the pot, but the base is made as wide as the height of the platform.

original: adhovedyā vistāras tad vedikāyā hrasve kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: adhas vedyāḥ vistāraḥ tat vedikāyāḥ hrasve kṛtam
translated: The width below the platform is made equal to the height of the platform.

original: kathaṃ pramāṇātikramaḥ /🔽bhūvastukalpanābalān nemyāṅgaṇapramāṇasya pramāṇe 'ntaḥkaraṇād anatikramaḥ kalaśākṛteḥ /
analyzed: katham pramāṇa atikramaḥ  bhū vastu kalpanā balāt nemyā aṅgaṇa pramāṇasya pramāṇe ntaḥkaraṇāt anatikramaḥ kalaśa ākṛteḥ
translated: How is there an excess over the prescribed size?🔽Due to the power of imagining the ground, there is no excess of the size of the courtyard within the prescribed size, of the shape of a pot.

analyzed: vedyunnāmasya alpa tvāt nimarjanam na ākṣyam
translated: Because the height of the platform is small, it is not necessary to measure it.

original: Slkv unnāmena tathā kuryād ity ādi /
analyzed: unnāmena tathā kuryāt iti ādi
translated: One should make it like this with the height of the platform, and so on.

analyzed: tat uktam bhavati
translated: This is what is said.

original: harmikām upādāya yo 'dhaś caturthabāhyakoṣṭhāṃśas tasya yo vibhāgaḥ prākkṛtas tenaiva vibhāgenaikona tisro vedyaḥ jaṃghāvedikādyā ity āvyāhāryaṃ
analyzed: harmikām upādāya yaḥ caturtha bāhya koṣṭha aṃśaḥ tasya yaḥ vibhāgaḥ prāk kṛtaḥ tena eva vibhāgena eka ūna tisraḥ vedyaḥ jaṃghā vedikā ādyāḥ iti āvyāhāryam
translated: Starting from the harmika, the part below the fourth outer square, by that very division made earlier, one should make the three platforms minus one, namely the ankle platform and so on, as stated.

original: na nirgacchet yathā biṃbam ity ādi /
analyzed: na nirgacchet yathā biṃbam iti ādi
translated: It should not protrude, like the image, and so on.

analyzed: udakogamanena udakogamana SINe kṛtāyām kṛ SLPaF nemyām nemi SLF
translated: In the courtyard made by the water-level,

analyzed: alpayām vā atha vasatyām nemitaḥ
translated: or in the small or large courtyard,

original: karaṇḍaṃ yathā nādhaḥ pratiset tathordhvāṃ vedīm unnatāṃ kuryāt /
analyzed: karaṇḍam yathā na adhas pratiset tathā ūrdhvām vedīm unnatām kuryāt
translated: one should make the upper platform as high as the pot does not touch the ground below.

analyzed: yatas dhaḥ praviṣṭaḥ na ādhāya kalpate
translated: From where it enters below, it is not suitable to be below.

analyzed: karaṇḍakehi udgatā iti ādi
translated: As stated in When the pot is raised and so on.

original: prādhyānyena ūrdhvavartinyāś caturthyā jaṃghāvedyā hrāsonnāmakaraṇenaiva kumbhasyodgamam adhomarjanañ ca saṃpadyate /
analyzed: prādhyānyena ūrdhva vartinyāḥ caturthyāḥ jaṃghāvedyāḥ hrāsa unnāma karaṇena eva kumbhasya udgamam adhas marjanam ca saṃpadyate
translated: By the instrumental case, the fourth [line] that is above, the decrease and increase of the ankle-altar itself accomplishes the raising and lowering of the pot.

analyzed: slkv p
translated: [The verse] beginning with

original: Slkv vedītrayasya connāmahrāso yataḥ tasmān nām' /
analyzed: vedi trayasya ca  unnāma unnāman Cp hrāsaḥ hrāsa SNM yatas yatas  tasmāt tasmāt  nām nāman
translated: Since there is the increase and decrease of the three altars, therefore [it is called] nāma.

original: adhoṃgaṇe ca kumbhe hrasvāt tato kuryād ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: ca kumbhe kuryāt iti arthaḥ
translated: And in the lower section, in the pot, one should make it short. This is the meaning.

original: yas tu paścād vakṣati /🔽kumbhasyodgamanaṃ tat kumbhasya dṛśyabhāgamātram apekṣati /
analyzed: yaḥ tu paścāt vakṣati  kumbhasya udgamanam tat kumbhasya dṛśya bhāga mātram apekṣati
translated: But one who will say later:🔽The raising of the pot depends only on the visible part of the pot.

analyzed: yatas tatra paramārthataḥ vedyā hrasya unnāma mātrā upalabhyate
translated: Because there, in reality, only the decrease and increase of the altar is perceived.

analyzed: na kumbhasya udgamanam adhas nimarjanam vā iti
translated: Not the raising of the pot or the lowering below.

original: karaṇḍaś ca tatas tūrikām iti jaṃghāpuṭāvedyā upari dhānyarāśy ādi saṃsthāne na kumbhaṃ vartulaṃ kuryāt //
analyzed: karaṇḍaḥ ca tatas tūrikām iti jaṃghā puṭā vedyāḥ upari dhānya rāśi ādi saṃsthāne na kumbham vartulam kuryāt
translated: And from that, the pot should not be made round, but rather a heap of grain and so on in the shape of the upper part of the ankle-pot.

analyzed: yatas prakīrṇe uktam
translated: Because it is said in the Prakīrṇaka:

analyzed: aṇḍakam aṇḍaka SNNe vaṭayitavyam vaṭay SNNeGd iti iti
translated: The pot should be made.

analyzed: navadhā vibhajitā iti ādi koṣṭha vibhāga kārikā dvayam sugamam
translated: The two verses on the division of the compartments beginning with divided into nine parts and so on are easy to understand.

original: bāhyakoṣṭhadvayonmānavedyāsanād udgato vartulārdhapauṣṭiko dhānyarāśisaṃsthāno na tu tribhāgocchritaḥ /
analyzed: bāhya koṣṭha dvaya unmāna vedyāsanāt udgataḥ vartula ardha pauṣṭikaḥ dhānya rāśi saṃsthānaḥ na tu tri bhāga ucchritaḥ
translated: It rises from the seat of the altar, which is the measure of the two outer chambers, and is round and half-nourishing, having the shape of a heap of grain, but not three parts high.

analyzed: śiva sthala tvāt iti
translated: Because it is the place of Śiva.

original: Slkv tasyādho bāhyakoṣṭhasyety ādi /🔽tasya vartulārdhāṃśyo yo bāhyakoṣṭho 'rdhamānena /
analyzed: tasya tad SGM adhas adhas  bāhya bāhya Cp koṣṭhasya koṣṭha SGM iti iti  ādi ādi  tasya vartula ardha aṃśyaḥ yaḥ bāhya koṣṭhaḥ ṛdha mānena
translated: Below that, from the outer chamber, etc.🔽That which is half the measure of the outer chamber, which is round and half,

analyzed: ardha bāhya koṣṭha unmāna vedyāsanāt yan samutthitaḥ
translated: rises from the seat of the altar, which is the measure of half the outer chamber.

analyzed: tad pātra ākāram śāntikām iti
translated: That is the shape of the vessel for peace.

analyzed: tataḥ pī di  tasmāt api pātra saṃsthānāt
translated: From that, the Pī.🔽From that vessel-shaped [altar],

analyzed: tena eva antara ukta pramāṇena bāhya koṣṭhaka unmāna vedya āsanāt yat samutthitam
translated: which rises from the seat of the altar, which is the measure of the inner chamber, with the very same measure mentioned before,

analyzed: tat unnati karam khag
translated: that is the height-making Khaga.

analyzed: aṇḍa a saṃsthānam iti
translated: It has the shape of an egg.

analyzed: sarva unmāna samam somyam iti ādi
translated: All the measures are equal, auspicious, etc.

original: abhiniveśamātraṃ apāsya yaḥ satvabhāvena īṣan samādhikabāhyakoṣṭhakordhvonmānāvedyāsanān samutthitaṃ /
analyzed: abhiniveśa mātram apāsya yaḥ satva bhāvena īṣan sama adhika bāhya koṣṭhaka ūrdhva unmāna āvedya āsanān samutthitam
translated: Having set aside mere attachment, whatever rises from the seat of the altar, which is the measure of the upper part of the inner chamber, with a slight excess in the form of sentient beings,

analyzed: tadā puṣpa karaṇḍeṣu na kartavyā ityādi
translated: then it should not be made in flower baskets, etc.

original: Slkv na kevalaṃ bodhisatvānāṃ pratimā kumbhena kāryā kāṃcaneti buddhapratimā api /
analyzed: na kevalam bodhisatvānām pratimā kumbhena kāryā kāṃcana iti  buddha buddha Cp pratimāḥ api
translated: Not only should the image of the Bodhisattvas be made of clay, but also the images of the Buddhas should be made of gold.

analyzed: yatas prakīrṇake uktam
translated: Because it is said in the Miscellaneous (Skandhaka):

original: lakṣam iti pratimālaṃkārair hi stūpam alaṃkartum iti /
analyzed: lakṣam iti pratimā alaṃkāraiḥ hi stūpam alaṃkartum iti
translated: A hundred thousand means to adorn a stupa with images and ornaments.

original: yatra hi pratimālaṃkārasyāpi pratiṣedhas tatra kathaṃ pratimāyā syāt /
analyzed: yatra hi pratimā alaṃkārasya api pratiṣedhaḥ tatra katham pratimāyā syāt
translated: Where there is a prohibition even of an image ornament, how could there be an image there?

analyzed: svayam bhagavatā stūpa pradakṣiṇī iti
translated: Because the Blessed One himself circumambulated a stupa out of compassion.

original: Slkv tad ūrdhvaṃ bāhyakoṣṭhasyety ādi bāhyakoṣṭhasya bhāgatyāgonnāmataś caturthārdhaparityāgaḥ parigrahaḥ śeṣapādatrayasya cch /
analyzed: tat ūrdhvam bāhya koṣṭhasya iti ādi bāhya koṣṭhasya bhāga tyāga unnāmataḥ caturtha ardha parityāgaḥ parigrahaḥ śeṣa pāda trayasya
translated: From there upwards, of the outer chamber, etc. means the outer chamber's portion is abandoned, and the designation is the abandonment of the fourth half, the acceptance is of the remaining three quarters.

original: id unnāmas Slkv p / tasya ṣaṭ kṛtvā ardhāṃśaṃ kumbhāntaḥ praviṣṭam āṃśadvayaṃ kaṇṭhakaṃ /
analyzed: tasya ṣaṭ kṛ ardha aṃśam kumbha antar  praviṣṭam ā  aṃśa dvayam kaṇṭhakam
translated: This is the designation. Its six times the half-part enters inside the vase, two parts is the neck.

original: Slkv ekam āṃśakaṃ kaṇṭhikāvalitakāṃ harmikā yathākramaṃ /
analyzed: ekam eka SAM āṃśakam āṃśaka SAM kaṇṭhikā kaṇṭhikā Cp valitakām valitakā SAF harmikā harmikā SNF yathākramam yathākramam
translated: One part is the neck, the balcony, and the harmika respectively.

analyzed: ekādaśa bhāga vṛdhyāḥ ardha aṃśa vistārataḥ vā
translated: By increasing by eleven parts, or with a width of half a part,

original: bāhyakoṣṭhavistārā harmikā tasyādhaḥ svonmānena samantataḥ kaṇṭhakaṃ //
analyzed: bāhya koṣṭha vistārā harmikā tasya adhas sva unmānena samantataḥ kaṇṭhakam
translated: the harmika is the width of the outer chamber. Below it, the neck is all around with its own measure.

analyzed: kṣīṇām kuryāt
translated: One should make it diminish.

original: yathā śobhānurūpato vā anyathā kalpayed iti /
analyzed: yathā śobhā anurūpataḥ vai anyathā kalpayet iti
translated: Or according to the beauty, one should imagine otherwise.

analyzed: se sākārikā sugamā
translated: That is easy to understand with its form.

analyzed: pañcaviṃśati koṣṭham iti ādi
translated: The twenty-five-chambered, etc.

original: pañcaviṃśatikoṣṭhavibhāgena yaṣṭer mūlamadhyaśirasā parigrahaṃ sugamo harmikāyā ūrdhvaṃ catuṣṭha pi kumbhasaṃsthāneṣu bāhyakoṣṭhadvayonmāno
analyzed: pañcaviṃśati koṣṭha vibhāgena yaṣṭeḥ mūla madhya śirasā parigraham sugamaḥ harmikāyāḥ ūrdhvam kumbha saṃsthāneṣu
translated: The enclosure of the base, middle, and top of the sacrificial post by dividing into twenty-five squares is easy. Above the harmika, in the four places shaped like pots, the height is two squares outside.

analyzed: dhas va yāvat
translated: Below, up to the heart square.

analyzed: hṛdaya koṣṭha praveśaḥ stūpaḥ
translated: The stupa enters the heart square.

analyzed: kalaśa ādi saṃsthāneṣu yathākrameṇa hṛdaya koṣṭha udgamāt
translated: In the places shaped like a pot, etc., in order, from the emergence of the heart square.

original: yathā yaṣṭer āyāmakṣayāṃ vā pariṇāhakṣayo vāpy avagantavyam ity evaṃ yāvat /🔽Slkv stūpalakṣaṇaṃ pramāṇaṃ saṃsthānatas sunirdiṣṭam /
analyzed: yathā yaṣṭeḥ āyāma kṣayām vā pariṇāha kṣayaḥ vā api avagantavyam iti evam yāvat  stūpa stūpa Cp lakṣaṇam lakṣaṇa SNNe pramāṇam pramāṇa SNNe saṃsthānataḥ saṃsthāna SBNe su su  nirdiṣṭam nirdiś
translated: As much as the length of the sacrificial post is exhausted, or the circumference is exhausted, it should be understood in this way.🔽Thus, the characteristics of the stupa are well-defined in terms of measure and shape.

analyzed: yathā śobhata atha ukta lakṣaṇa pramāṇa an atikrameṇa saṃsthānataḥ
translated: If it is not beyond the characteristics and measures stated, in terms of shape, by the protrusion of the pot-shaped [harmika], it is beautiful.

analyzed: rajata maṇi kanaka śilā dāru mūrti kṛt iti
translated: Made of silver, jewels, gold, stone, or wood.

analyzed: surabhi pradeśe praśastā amanohare
translated: In a fragrant place, praised and delightful.

analyzed: sva hastena vā karma hastena vā
translated: Either by one's own hand or by the hand of a worker.

analyzed: tathā sva buddhyā kāryam
translated: Likewise, the design should be made with one's own intelligence.

original: yataḥ proktaṃ yathā syā śobhano bhavet /
analyzed: yatas proktam yathā syā śobhanaḥ bhavet
translated: As it is said, it should be beautiful.

analyzed: tathā kuryāt iti
translated: One should make it in that way.

analyzed: āgame ismin iti
translated: In this scripture.

analyzed: stūpa lakṣaṇa śāstrasya vastu mātra upadarśanāt
translated: Because it merely shows the substance of the treatise on the characteristics of stupas.

original: yan mayoparjitaṃ puṇyaṃ tenāstu stūpas tu sugato jana iti //
analyzed: yat mayā uparjitam puṇyam tena astu stūpaḥ tu sugataḥ janaḥ iti
translated: May I, by whatever merit I have accumulated, become a stupa of the Sugata, O people!

analyzed: stūpa lakṣaṇa kārikāyām vivecanam samāptam
translated: The analysis in the Stūpalakṣaṇakārikā is complete.

original: after this follows the Newārī note of a Nepalese librarian /
analyzed: after this follows the newārī note of a nepalese librarian
translated: After this follows the Newari note of a Nepalese librarian.

original: Slkv śrī syaṃguyāyita siyā jetanaku aṃgu liḍā yavanhasa saaṃkanaghāva //
analyzed: śrī śrī SNF siyā siyā U jetanaku jetanaku U  / aṃgu aṃgu U liḍā liḍā U
translated: SLKV: The Jaina temple in Syang-gu-ya-si, the Angu temple in Jey-tan-ku, the Yav-han-sa temple in Sa-aṅka-na-ghā.

original: ghātasaku ku ghalasaku umaḍe thaṃthu ucaku aṃ yavanhana pramāneti madhyamādi kramena //
analyzed: ghātasaku ku ghalasaku umaḍe thaṃthu ucaku aṃ pramāna iti madhyama ādi kramena
translated: The Ghata-sa-ku, the Ku-ghala-sa-ku, the Um-da-te, the Thum-thu, the Uchu-ku, the Aṅ, the Yav-han-na, the Pramāṇa, the Madhyamā, etc., in order.

analyzed: on the top drawsheet
translated: On the top drawing sheet.

analyzed: there are the following lines
translated: There are the following lines.

original: x x x x x pralase tīsijya pu manasīyā tachosathu se kho thu teya u /
analyzed: x x x x x pralase se kho thu teya u
translated: X x x x x Prasa-le ti-si-jya pu ma-na-si-yā tacho-sa-thu se kho thu tey u.

analyzed: na nesam
translated: Parita na ne-saṃ

original: ālayana // etad dharma x x x chela x x x x x //
analyzed: ālayana
translated: Ālaya-na. This Dharma x x x chela x x x x x.

analyzed: tat anantara draṃma dharmma
translated: After that, the Dharma Dharma Likya

analyzed: buna āleyana
translated: Bhun ālaya-na.

analyzed: stupa lakṣaṇa kārikāyām vivecanam
